thread.title: Re: News on the morning routine not updating
thread.title_full: Re: News on the morning routine not updating

author: Jeremyg
title: Re: News on the morning routine not updating
text:
a week ago
As mentioned in the title, Its been months since in one of my devices news arent updating.
Ive tried doing a Factory reset, reconfiguring the routine and swapping around the news media but nothing
This just happen in a smart watch with Google assitant. The rest of the devices works fine
Saturday
Hi [@iSanta](/t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/616319)!
We appreciate you contacting the community. I apologize if your Google Assistant is giving you trouble, but don't worry—help is on the way.
We appreciate that you tried to resolve the issue with a factory reset. I am aware that you need to pair it with the Google Home app. I need to know a few things about your smart watch in order to provide you with a better resolution.
I'll be waiting for your response; any additional details you can provide will be helpful.
Best regards,
Jeremy.
Sunday
Hey Jeremi,
I've already tried doing a factory reset a few times.
The issue is on a Xiaomi smart watch.
Tuesday
I appreciate your efforts to fix the routine. I understand how frustrating it must be that this hasn't been resolved. But no worries, so let’s explore more options.
Let me know how it goes.
Regards,
Jeremy.
yesterday
Hi Jeremy,
I've done another factory reset on the Smart watch, aswell as checked the routine as you mentioned.
In the routine the trigger is just the word Good Morning (in my case buenos dias) and in the watch, inside the alarm configuration the good morning routine option is configured.
Again, I set up an alarm for a minute later to try it to no result, the first news are still the same as they where as for the past months.
I tried the routine in my phone and google nest and the news are updated without an issue
7m ago
Hi [@iSanta](/t5/user/viewprofilepage/user-id/616319)!
We appreciate you taking the actions we suggested to fix the issue with your routines. We have already attempted every appropriate troubleshooting step in this particular instance, yet the issue still persists. Getting in touch with your product's manufacturer is your best bet.
Feel free to reply if you have any questions.
Regards,
Jeremy.
